generif.text: Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Data suggest that LIMCH1 plays a positive role in regulation of NM-II activity through effects on MRLC during cell migration.
LMO7 and LIMCH1 co-localized and co-immunoprecipitated.
LIMCH1 is a negative regulator involved in a new molecular mechanism for the pathogenesis of lung cancer with HUWE1 and p53
Nup93 regulates breast tumor growth by modulating cell proliferation and actin cytoskeleton remodeling.
A 10-gene prognostic signature points to LIMCH1 and HLA-DQB1 as important players in aggressive cervical cancer disease.
LIMCH1 as a New Potential Metastasis Predictor in Breast Cancer.

BP.term: positive regulation of stress fiber assembly
positive regulation of stress fiber assembly
cytoplasmic actin-based contraction involved in cell motility

name: LIM and calponin homology domains 1
other_names: LIM and calponin homology domains-containing protein 1
summary: Enables myosin II head/neck binding activity. Involved in several processes, including cytoplasmic actin-based contraction involved in cell motility; positive regulation of stress fiber assembly; and regulation of focal adhesion assembly. Located in stress fiber. Colocalizes with myosin II complex. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
